You could use MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON directly instead of creating a constant that holds a constant.

I did this so I can easiy switch between JSON and XML in all methods. If I don't this I may have to change to XML, for example, and mistakely request JSON and send XML bodies (and vice versa). To avoid confusion I renamed my constant to REQUEST_MEDIA_TYPE.

Don't these strings require i18n?
Not in this case because these are keys used in Kie Server - keys to the query target

Can we split all long methods into smaller ones? It seems that they have many responsibilities that could be broken down into more specialized methods. Plus, it'd be easier for other developers to work on this class in the future.
Thakns for the feedback. I am refactoring this method. I brought it from jbpm-wb and didn't touch it too much, also, didn't add tests, but I will make some cleanup and add some tests
